pros: Subject matter experts across such a diverse range of skill sets, from the hard sciences of epidemiology, microbiology and public health to the exploratory sciences of data, AI, machine learning, etc, and everything in between, including insurance, government services, consulting, technology.
cons: Prioritizing so many promising opportunities and projects while balancing them against funding, timing and resource challenges
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing; honesty, accountability, cross-functional teamwork, staying true to the mission but willing to consider product growth in realms that might be difficult to do but rewarding in terms of financial endpoints

pros:
-Great people to work with
-Company has lots of potential
cons: -Annual bonus could be higher

review_title: Not a Stable or Ethical Place
pros: The work I was a part of had a decent amount of travel opportunities and a lot of hands on experience, plus (on the surface level) a great culture, but that was really dependent on the people you worked and if you were lucky and on the right side of management making the calls.
cons: If you need and value stability, especially in the Government side, ethics, or advancement due to merit, this isn't the place for you. There were no opportunities to shift within the organization, regardless of the efforts you made as an individual. It is also not a place you want to bring or leverage your network with, as they will be used and burned as other people see fit. The value was always the short, cash-grabbing win, regardless of the cost in reputation, relationships within the community, or professional ethics. After leaving, I and a number of colleagues have had to work against this negative reputation, and I have personally been called out on it in interviews for positions with their former USG clients. And yes, some of the high level leadership (C-suite) has now changed since I left, but that reputation has held true years later within the community.
advice_to_mgmt: Don't hire people if you don't have a plan or funding for them for more than a few months, be willing to have tough conversations with the staff you manage if you don't think they are meeting your expectations, stop burning your reputation and staff's networks, and maybe read some books on professional ethics and the FAR.

review_title: Best work environment I've experienced so far
pros:
- Great people with exemplary values
-Powered by a mission that gives meaning to everyday tasks
- Flat organization with lots of room for growth
- Great location and office amenities, as well as flexibility in work arrangements
cons:
- Typical pressure to achieve milestones that comes with being a start up
- Lean and mean, which means the company is frugal
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up! I feel optimistic and empowered to make a difference

review_title: Poor leadership ran DC into ground, trying to rebound
pros: The company has a noble mission supported by smart people.
cons: The former President ran the DC office into the ground by expanding into a ritzy neighborhood and adding a bunch of people without revenue to support it. Within 9 months, the founding CEO resigned and the DC office was shuttered despite most of the clients being located in DC after not landing a single new client in a year and losing their largest client. It's a shame because it could have been something special. Now the SF office survives on the left coast with orphaned east coast clients. Sales turnover was 100% despite leadership 101 issues making it a lost cause from the beginning. At least the board eventually fired the President (Robert Mann). Not that this helped the people who were hired/poached only to be laid off a few months later.
advice_to_mgmt: As you rebuild, focus on your core mission, keep a check on leaders with egos that are detached from reality. An opulent startup easily strays from it's mission. The team didn't do this, but leadership definitely did.

pros:
Company trying to solve a big problem
Has a strong foundational government business
Innovating a novel solution for insurers and others
Momentum is building for what the company offers
Really nice, smart people
cons:
Insurers are slow to adopt
Can be lots of travel
advice_to_mgmt: Keep focused and doing what you're doing. Look for more opportunities for employees to share their knowledge with each other.

pros: Was hired while in grad school -decent pay and experience.
cons: Tedious tasks, no room to grow, and management was awful.

review_title: Stay away from this dumpster fire. Robert Mann is the King Joffrey of start-ups!
pros:
- really cool vision
- founder has done some incredible work in the field
- opportunity to work in 3 different verticals (food safety, gov & insurance)
cons:
- management are maniacal, they don't care about anyone but themselves
- the COO was more interested in name dropping his fancy lifestyle than leading
- direction/roadmap changes every week
- no viable product, only services
- CEO is majorly into himself, and his personal office is 1/10 the size of the entire place
advice_to_mgmt: I hear they fired Robert Mann (COO) and hired someone people can actually work with. Good job, he was single handedly tanking this company.

pros: Decent position for a part time job during school. flexible times
cons: monotonous as it is mostly data entry

pros: Employees were provided with good laptops and monitors, without delays.
cons: Micromanagement, unwillingness to recognize those with experience and knowledge. Disregard for regulatory environment.
advice_to_mgmt: Concentrate on non-USG Clients because this organization is not a viable government contractor.

pros: I love the mission and the forward direction of this company - using data and science, including building research capacity, to support global health programs.
cons:
As a part-time employee, I feel very disconnected and under-utilized. I have gone over 6 months without any assignments, despite many times asking to get more involved in ongoing or future work. The company benefits more from me being on their employee roster (to be able to boast X many employees with vast expertise) than I do.

I've heard from female colleagues that upper management is sexist.
advice_to_mgmt: Engage more with your part-time employees. Reach out to them regularly and consider ways to keep them engaged and up to date with what's going on.

review_title: Interesting global health startup with vast potential for growth
pros: very engaging and meaningful work on the global/public health front; really smart and talented people; fairly transparent online communication of company's work; globally representative and diverse staff
cons: offices are split across North America and all over the world (also a pro), makes coordinated communication difficult; sometimes too much work is done remotely; part-time work is sporadic and sometimes not well directed, so difficult to understand if you are contributing appropriately
advice_to_mgmt: don't neglect us part-timers; please find opportunities to engage some of your part-time help for more solid full-time opportunities (if they arise) as otherwise feel stuck as a part-time employee

pros:
- Do cool things that matter - Certain companies say that, but Metabiota does actually help people and the world.
- Newish engineering group - its a great time to be here, as we are building out our infrastructure using the latest open source tech.
- Great group of people to work with - they are all super nice and welcoming.
- Smart too! - Everyone here is super smart, very driven, and has years of experience from various companies.
- A plan - Metabiota has a pretty good plan for where its going and its got a solid project management practice to back that up.
cons:
- As with any new and growing engineering department, we have lots of demands on what we need to and this can eat into a work-life balance. Admittedly, its still better than most companies in the valley (I rather enjoy weekends).
- Newish engineering group - as the group is new, a lot of the techstack needs to be built out and may change.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what your doing, and don't loose track of the company's core goals! Also, as we grow make sure that Engineering has room to move like it needs to.

pros: Really cool environment, everyone is extremely friendly. A great place to ask questions and learn. Learned a lot about epidemiology trends and some things about data
cons: I wish the data analyst role was more computer science orientated, but regardless it was good experience learning some basics about data and computer science

review_title: Exciting, challenging work. Brilliant, collaborative co-workers.
pros: Metabiota strives to hire top talent that is able to tackle the hard work of bringing the company's ambitious vision and goals to life. It's on the fast track of helping to change the intriguing intersection of science and data in a way that can and will make the world a safer place. Metabiota is growing rapidly and because of this, the environment provides a busy and ever changing landscape of new people and new projects. Co-workers are smart, approachable, driven and know how to enjoy their downtime. The benefits are generous and best of all, the company get-togethers are always lively and fun.
cons: Because of the rapid growth mode, Metabiota can be a challenging workplace in which to navigate one's way around without bringing the right amount of flexibility to roll with the flow. But what may not be easy for some can be a culture where others thrive.
advice_to_mgmt: Management is keeping us busier than ever and bringing more and more opportunity to our staff worldwide. Keep doing what you're doing because we are getting better and stronger everyday at what we want to accomplish!

pros: The "written" mission of the organization is notable .Colleagues are a pleasure.
cons: Executive team operates based on the bottom line. Be prepared to work in an environment where the management is often critical, overbearing, and expects you to deliver on unrealistic expectations.

review_title: Interesting industry with a lot of growth potential, poorly managed company with little organization.
pros: The company is focused on good work. They have the opportunity to help improve the places where they are engaed.
cons: Poor management structure. Lack of vision about how to grow the company. Over-reliance on processes from past work that have no application to current or future work. Micro management of employees who are successful and accomplished in their own right. Thier indecisive and non transparent actions with basic company decisions foster an atmosphere of instability and untrustworthiness in employees.
advice_to_mgmt: Bring in management consultants and heed thier advice. Ensure that managers have either prior management experience or training. Listen to your employees' suggestions. Be more transparent with you decision making.

pros:
Excellent staff that is highly educated and driven
Opportunities to grow
cons: Ineffective management that fails to communicate, continually changing requirements result in much rework and lost time, lack of management skills of those in leadership positions, revenue focused with human resources utilized to maximize profits, a high amount of part time employees are hired such that the company saves on benefits, health insurance, and transportation costs, employees are overworked, stressed, and micromanaged with an underlying mangerial lack of trust and support
advice_to_mgmt: Gain employee feedback, use 360 reviews, seek managerial training, clearly define tasks and requirements, provide positive feedback to employees

pros:
- Very impressive company doing important, fascinating, and profitable work
- Great co-workers and laid-back environment
- Corporate culture is 'we trust you' and give you support when you need it
- Groundbreaking research
cons: - Relatively new company and expanding rapidly, so many roles are still somewhat undefined
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to drive forward aggressively. You own this market space, so take advantage of that.

pros: Job security and good pay.
cons: Not very challenging, more branches needed.

pros: People are nice and friendly, very comfortable to work there
cons: It's a small team in BC, no much opportunities to develop career

pros: Metabiota is a rapidly growing company combing scientific and business approaches. It constantly seeks for innovations proposing high-end information technology solutions to its clients from both governmental and private sectors.
cons: Hard to stay on one page with other colleagues because of many groups distributed around the globe.
advice_to_mgmt: Strategic program for personnel training could help finding new internal capabilities and rise multi-talented professionals inside the Company connecting them more closely to the Company's goals and culture.
